entry.def: If something moves or is put onto an object or surface, it is then on that object or surface.

example.ex: I took my bags inside, lowered myself onto the bed and switched on the TV...
example.tran: 我把包拎进屋，往床上一倒，然后打开了电视机。

example.ex: Smear Vaseline on to your baby's skin to prevent soreness.
example.tran: 给孩子皮肤上抹些凡士林以防止肿痛。

entry.def: You can sometimes use onto to mention the place or area that someone moves into.

example.ex: The players emerged onto the field...
example.tran: 运动员入场了。

example.ex: ...when the photographer sets off onto the moors...
example.tran: 摄影师动身踏入高沼时

entry.def: You can use onto to introduce the place towards which a light or someone's look is directed.

example.ex: ...the metal part of the door onto which the sun had been shining...
example.tran: 在阳光照耀下闪闪发亮的门的金属部分

example.ex: The colours rotated round on a disc and were reflected onto the wall behind.
example.tran: 圆盘上色彩流转，反射到后面的墙上。

entry.def: You can use onto to introduce a place that you would immediately come to after leaving another place that you have just mentioned, because they are next to each other.

example.ex: ...windows opening onto carved black-wood balconies...
example.tran: 开向黑檀雕花阳台的窗户

example.ex: The door opened onto a lighted hallway.
example.tran: 这扇门通往亮着灯的走廊。

entry.def: When you change the position of your body, you use onto to introduce the part your body which is now supporting you.

example.ex: As he stepped backwards she fell onto her knees, then onto her face...
example.tran: 他向后退时，她双膝跪倒在地，接着迎面倒了下去。

example.ex: Puffing a little, Mabel shifted her weight onto her feet...
example.tran: 梅布尔喘了口气，把身体重心移到脚上。

entry.def: When you get onto a bus, train, or plane, you enter it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: As he got on to the plane, he asked me how I was feeling...
example.tran: 他上飞机时问我感觉如何。

example.ex: Who can fold up a pushchair, toddler and shopping and then get them all onto the bus?...
example.tran: 谁有那本事一手收起婴儿推车，一手抱着刚会走路的孩子，还得提着刚买的东西，然后挤上公共汽车？

entry.def: Onto is used after verbs such as 'hold', 'hang', and 'cling' to indicate what someone is holding firmly or where something is being held firmly.
entry.tran: （用于 hold，hang，cling 等动词后，表示抓紧或牢牢固定）在…上

example.ex: The reflector is held onto the sides of the spacecraft with a frame...
example.tran: 反射器通过支架牢牢地固定在航天器的侧面。

example.ex: She was conscious of a second man hanging on to the rail...
example.tran: 她意识到还有第二个人紧紧抓着栏杆。

entry.def: If people who are talking get onto a different subject, they begin talking about it.

example.ex: Let's get on to more important matters...
example.tran: 咱们谈谈更重要的事吧。

example.ex: So, if we could just move onto something else?
example.tran: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

entry.def: You can sometimes use onto to indicate that something or someone becomes included as a part of a list or system.
entry.tran: 成为（列表、系统等）的一部分

example.ex: The Macedonian question had failed to get on to the agenda...
example.tran: 马其顿问题没能列入议事日程。

example.ex: The pill itself has changed a lot since it first came onto the market...
example.tran: 该药片本身自首次进入市场以来已经有了很大改变。

entry.def: If someone is onto something, they are about to discover something important.

example.ex: He leaned across the table and whispered to me, 'I'm really onto something.'...
example.tran: 他从桌上俯过身来对我低声说道：“我真的就快有重大发现了。”

example.ex: Archaeologists knew they were onto something big when they started digging.
example.tran: 考古学家在发掘之初就知道他们将有重大发现。

entry.def: If someone is onto you, they have discovered that you are doing something illegal or wrong.
entry.tran: 发现（某人做坏事）；对…觉察；对…知悉

example.ex: He did not want Pollard to become suspicious that he was now onto him...
example.tran: 他不想让波拉德怀疑他已察觉到其不轨行为。

example.ex: I had told people what he had been doing, so now the police were onto him.
example.tran: 我已将他的所作所为告诉了别人，因此现在警方正在追查他。

Sentence.sentence: But there is also time for brief diversions onto bizarre ground, such as a discussion of the skyscraper index (which holds that a boom in skyscraper construction is a foolproof sign of an imminent recessio.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For years private colleges such as Princeton and MIT have had success bringing minorities onto campus in the summer before freshman year to give them some preparatory courses.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Maybe so, but someone managed to get that hand gun onto the aircraft or it couldn't have been there.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: "What we find is you actually look at the world slightly differently, because you're looking for things you want to capture, that you may want to hang onto," Dehl explains. "That gets people more engaged in the experience, and they tend to enjoy it more."
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Kasselman wants to build an array of solar magnifying mirrors at one end of the line to collect and focus heat onto water-filled tubes.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Rosen says he'll use the last of his savings to try to hang onto the home he worked for more than 20 years to buy.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: What we find is you actually look at the world slightly differently, because you're looking for things you want to capture, that you may want to hang onto, Dehl explains.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section C

example.en: I have to latch onto a hundred bucks by Friday night.
example.zh: 我得在星期五晚上之前弄到100 块钱。

example.en: When you find the page,latch on.
example.zh: 你找到那一页，就看下去。

example.en: Would you mind repeating that? I didn't quite latch on.
example.zh: 那句话请你再说一遍好吗？我没有完全听懂。

example.en: When Fred finally hatched onto the principles of algebra, he began to get better grades.
example.zh: 当弗雷德最终掌握了代数的基本原理时，他的成绩开始好了起来。

list.explanation: 使自己附属于…，依靠，缠住不放

example.en: He latched onto me as soon as I arrived.

Sentence.sentence: By the time these "solutions" become widely available, scammers will have moved onto cleverer means.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: During these waits, the brain slips away from the body and wanders about until the water runs over the edge of the counter and onto your socks.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Imagine my surprise when I stepped foot onto UCR's campus, where over 400 organizations exist, ranging from political organizations to karate club.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: So no one throws things onto the stage in Australia?
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: They dropped off onto the floor.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: They hope to discourage the seabirds from wandering onto the highway.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: They reflect a concentrated beam of light onto the town's central square, creating an area of sunlight roughly 600 square meters.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Think carefully before posting anything onto such websites.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: When choosing everyday products such as toothpaste, we appreciate a cool-looking device that allows us to easily squeeze the toothpaste onto our brush.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 选词填空  原文

means: 向，朝；朝向，面向（某个方向）

Sentence.sentence: But brain researchers have discovered that when we consciously develop new habits, we create parallel synaptic paths, and even entirely new brain cells, that can jump our trains of thought onto new, innovative tracks.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But brain researchers have discovered that when we consciously develop new habits, we create parallel paths, and even entirely new brain cells, that can jump our trains of thought onto new, innovative tracks.
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In France, shareholders who hold onto a company investment for at least two years can sometimes earn more voting rights in a company.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: They could even be detrimental, satisfying a need to have "done our bit" without ever progressing onto bigger, bolder, more effective actions—a kind of "moral licensing" that allays our concerns and stops us doing more and asking more of those in charge.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

means.word_mean: (表示对象)推卸到, 转嫁给; 发觉; 转向, 转移到

sentences.en: They tried to put the blame onto me.
sentences.cn: 他们试图将责任推卸到我身上。
我觉察到了他的阴谋诡计。

sentences.en: I think we're onto something big.
sentences.cn: 我想我们正在干一番大事业。</seg>
用茶匙把生面团舀到烤盘上。
sentences.en: Drop the dough onto a baking sheet with a teaspoon.

sentences.cn: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？
sentences.en: So, if we could just move onto something else?

sentences.cn: 别在救生衣上的灯提高了获救可能性。
sentences.en: Lights clipped onto life jackets improve the chances of rescue.

sentences.cn: 她将自己睡袍的吊带拉到肩膀上。
sentences.en: She pulled the strap of her nightgown onto her shoulder.

sentences.cn: 麦卡纳利双膝发软，瘫倒在地板上。
sentences.en: Mcanally's knees buckled and he crumpled down onto the floor.

sentences.cn: 敌军对该城发起连串炮轰。
sentences.en: Enemy forces lobbed a series of artillery shells onto the city.

sentences.cn: 新复印机只能单面复印。
sentences.en: The new copiers only copy onto one side of the paper.

sentences.cn: 他以为她有着和自己相同的想法和观点。
sentences.en: He projects his own thoughts and ideas onto her.

sentences.cn: 她不得不抓紧门把手，直到那阵疼痛过去。
sentences.en: She had to cling onto the doorhandle until the pain passed.

sentences.cn: 克里斯手脚并用爬上了公路。
sentences.en: Chris crawled on his hands and knees out onto the highway.

sentences.cn: 她爬到了他窗外的窗台上。
sentences.en: She had climbed onto the ledge outside his window.

sentences.cn: 她抓住扶手以保持平衡。
sentences.en: She was holding onto the rail to keep her balance.

sentences.cn: 一段石阶从鹅卵石路上一直向上直通城墙。
sentences.en: A number of staircases ascend from the cobbled streets onto the ramparts.

sentences.cn: 20世纪80年代初他突然在时尚界活跃起来。
sentences.en: He burst onto the fashion scene in the early 1980s.

sentences.cn: 他烂醉如泥，瘫倒在沙发上。
sentences.en: He fell back onto the sofa in a drunken stupor.

Sentence.sentence: He drove back out onto the street, looking for a parking space.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: And he can load them onto the shuttle for you when it arrives.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The wind blew the baby onto the tracks.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月四级真题（第二套）听力 Section B
